comment: Python: Good work cleaning the data.
Python: Consider using display() instead of print() to display DataFrames. Using print() will forcefully convert a DataFrame into a non-tabular (i.e., plain string) format.

Python: Your notebook did not run due to a code block that references an unimported package or a file that only exists in your Google Colab or Jupyter environment. We have excluded those code cells from grading.
Python: Great use of geographic maps. We have not covered Plotly geographic map visualizations using Mapbox, but you've done research on your own to create maps.

Python: A box plot is not useful when you have an ordinal categorical variable like review_rating. The distribution of the review_rating column would be better represented with a bar chart or a pie chart.
Python: Your scatter plot uses a non-numeric data type in one of the axes. For scatter plots, always use numeric values for both axes.
Python: Latitude and longitude cooridnates are only useful when they are used in a geographic map. Consider using a geographic map visual (e.g., mapbox with plotly).
Python: A line chart should only have a few lines or use color as a contrast so that the trends are clearly communicated.

Python: Your sunburst chart has too many branches. A cluttered sunburst chart was explicitly shared as an example of a bad visualization in class. Preprocess the data so that you selectively display fewer categories or merge smaller categories into an "Other" category.
Python: Your treemap chart has too many branches. Preprocess the data so that you selectively display fewer categories or merge smaller categories into an "Other" category.
Python: Nice work incorporating text analysis into your notebook.

Python: Although you have showed the results of the tokenization and sentiment analysis, we did not see any additional analyses based on those results. For example, which tokens were most often associated with positive and/or negative tokens? Is there a specific company with an unusually high frequency of one or more tokens (e.g., maintenance, elevator, deposit)?
Python: To use the sentiment scores in your analysis, make sure you distinguish positive/sentiment scores. For example, convert the "NEGATIVE" sentiment scores to a negative value.
Python: We recommend cleaning up your notebook so that it can be used as a portfolio. The notebook contains text/code cells that require additional explanations on how they are relevant.
Tableau: You have not met the minimum requirements to create 10 different visualizations.
Tableau: Your visual depicts inaccurate information.
Tableau: Displaying the sum of review ratings or review likes does not convery any useful information. Consider using the average instead.
Tableau: For bar charts, sort the bars in ascending or descending orders unless the categories is ordinal.

Tableau: To use a time-series in the x-axis, consider aggregating dates into weeks, months, or years. Using the day as a unit will result in a cluttered and incomprehensible chart due to too many data points.

Visualization: Creating meaningful visualizations is a time-consuming process that requires data manipulation before passing the data to a plotting library. Some of your visuals felt like they were created to meet the minimum requirements, not to communicate any interesting insights to the viewers. I would encourage you to think from a viewer's point. Why is a visual relevant to the context of leasing companies in one or more campuses?

General: Overall, good efforts. However, we see a large room for improvement. We wish that you had submitted the first draft so that we could have provided feedback to guide you in the right direction with the visualizations and NLP analysis. We are confident that you will take the knowledge from this case study and apply it to solve real-world problems.
General: Very nice work! We are confident that you will take the knowledge from this case study and apply it to solve real-world problems.
